1.title: Max Payne
1.plot: It made an awesome game, but the film version brought on a different kind of pain. Nostalgia Critic checks out Max Payne.

2.title: When Did Marvel Villains Get Good?
2.plot: The MCU has had hit after hit, but their villains have been dud after dud. Somehow though, they recently got better and better. What is Marvel doing now that's different from before?

3.title: RoboCop
3.plot: It failed to win over audiences and critics, but is there more to this Robo-reboot that meets the eye?

4.title: The History of the M&M Characters
4.plot: We all know them but never talk about them. Where did they come from? Who's idea was it? Do the green ones really make you...you know? The Nostalgia Critic answers all these questions and more about your favorite chocolate candy, M&Ms.

5.title: Black Cauldron
5.plot: It's called the film that almost killed Disney, but how much of this animated black sheep is good and how much is not? The Nostalgia Critic takes a look at 1985's Black Cauldron.

6.title: Top 11 Funniest Siskel and Ebert Reviews
6.plot: These two left a lot of great arguments and bickering moments, but which ones made us laugh the hardest? Nostalgia Critic takes a look at the funniest moments from Siskel and Ebert.

7.title: The Country Bears
7.plot: Christopher Walken, talking grizzly's, and country music? How could anything in this go right? Well believe it or not, Nostalgia Critic finds a few things right in, The Country Bears.

8.title: Donnie Darko
8.plot: This art-house darling has a lot of people wondering, is this a deep classic or pretentious slosh? Can it be both? Nostalgia Critic gives his thoughts on Donnie Darko.

9.title: Episode #12.9
9.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

10.title: Episode #12.10
10.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Transformers: The Movie Review
1.plot: The Nostalgia Critic begins his reviewing career with a quick review of Michael Bay's adaptation of "Transformers."

2.title: Drug Cartoon Special
2.plot: Nostalgic disappointment abound when the The Nostalgia Critic reviews the VHS of "Cartoon All-Stars to the Rescue", a crossover of epic (and educational) proportions. From Simon from "Alvin and the Chipmunks" discussing marijuana, to cheesy songs about saying no to drugs, to a speech by H.W. Bush himself, The Critic attempts to survive this byproduct of his drug-riddled childhood. will he?

3.title: Cloverfield Trailer Review
3.plot: The critic talks about the trailer of clover filed.

4.title: Power Rangers: A Look Back
4.plot: The Critic decides to review the 1995 film, Mighty Morphin' Power Rangers: The Movie.

5.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Launch
5.plot: The Critic is among the many Harry Potter fans anticipating the midnight release of the final Harry Potter book, "Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows."

6.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
6.plot: An avid fan of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, the Critic reviews all three of the live-action Turtle movies, but is disappointed by how poorly they hold up.

7.title: Top 11 Scariest Nostalgic Moments
7.plot: The critic does his first top 11 list.

8.title: Super Mario Bros.: The Movie
8.plot: The Critic reviews the 1993 live-action adaptation of Super Mario Bros. He feels that it does the game, as well as movies in general, a grave injustice.

9.title: Cloverfield
9.plot: J.J. Abrams' monster movie "Cloverfield" is finally released and, upon seeing it, the Nostalgia Critic is disappointed that the monster in question is just a monster. Giving his opinion on the film, he then proceeds to re-enact the movie using his hand-held VHS camera.

10.title: Street Fighter and Mortal Kombat: The Movie Reviews - Part 1
10.plot: In this two-part episode, the Critic reviews two of the most popular fighting games that became really bad movies. First up: Street Fighter, a movie saved only by the performance of the late Raul Julia as M. Bison.

11.title: Street Fighter and Mortal Kombat: The Movie Reviews - Part 2
11.plot: In the conclusion of this 2-part episode, the Critic reviews the other bad movie based on a popular fighting game: Mortal Kombat, a movie weighed down by Johnny Cage's bad quips.

12.title: Space Jam
12.plot: When the Critic reviews Space Jam, he becomes extremely dismayed, being a big fan of the old school Looney Tunes, he dislikes all the new-age humor and winks to the audience. That and the prospect of a sexualized cartoon bunny is quite sickening to him.

13.title: Angry Video Game Nerd Rant
13.plot: The Critic becomes annoyed by all of the Nerd's fans comparing them, and tells him to just admit that the Critic is superior.

14.title: Angry Video Game Nerd Rant: Part 2
14.plot: When the Nerd responds to the Critic's rant by claiming to be a fan of his, the Critic searches to uncover the inevitable hidden insult.

15.title: Pokemon the Movie
15.plot: The critic despite not having any knowledge of the franchise he reviews Pokémon the first movie.

16.title: AVGN Wizard Rant
16.plot: The Critic is outraged to discover that the Nerd plans to beat him to a review of the movie "The Wizard", and believes he is doing it out of petty jealousy.

17.title: The Wizard
17.plot: The Critic reviews the movie "The Wizard" and comes to the conclusion that it's more fun to play video games than to watch people play them, and suspects nobody from the movie went on to have a career...or did they?

18.title: Top 11 Naughtiest Moments in Animaniacs
18.plot: The Critic praises Animaniacs for being written just as much for adults as for children, and cites examples.

19.title: Batman and Robin
19.plot: The Critic reviews the worst Batman movie ever made, becomes particularly outraged at the Bat-Credit Card, and concludes with a rousing musical number.

20.title: Top 11 Catchiest Theme Songs
20.plot: The Critic recounts all the theme songs from his childhood that still get stuck in his head.

21.title: 90's Sports Montage
21.plot: The Critic tries to get to the bottom of why we keep watching sports movies when they all have the same plot.

22.title: AVGN Response... Response
22.plot: The Nerd posts a video insulting the Critic, who then challenges him to review a horrible nostalgic movie.

23.title: Top 11 Drug PSAs
23.plot: The Critic reviews the top eleven most memorable Anti-Drug ads, some of which made more sense than others.

24.title: The Battle of Epic Proportions
24.plot: The Critic goes to confront the Nerd in person, who is appearing with Captain S at an event... and a live, slow-motion fistfight ensues. The Nerd agrees to review a horrible nostalgic movie... so long as the Critic also reviews a video game.

25.title: Captain Planet
25.plot: The Critic reviews Ted Turner's environmental propaganda cartoon Captain Planet, and even lands an interview with "cast member" Ma-Ti.

26.title: Double Dare
26.plot: The Critic praises Nickelodeon's innovative family game show "Double Dare", particularly the dedication of host Marc Summers.

27.title: 3 Ninjas
27.plot: The Critic accuses "3 Ninjas" of being a lame attempt to cash in on the success of "Home Alone" and the Ninja Turtles series.

28.title: Top 11 Hottest Animated Women
28.plot: The Critic counts down the sexiest animated women.

29.title: Video Game Review
29.plot: In response to a challenge put forth by the Angry Video Game Nerd, the Critic decides to do a video game review of a horrible game based on the film "Bebe's Kids."

30.title: The Search for the Nostalgia Chick
30.plot: The Critic puts out a call for a contest for women to become the Nostalgia Chick.

31.title: He-Man and the Masters of the Universe
31.plot: The Critic believes He-Man to be the gayest action hero we ever had as children, and reviews the live-action film adaptation.

32.title: Follow That Bird
32.plot: The Critic tries to rip apart the first Sesame Street movie, but even he has a sentimental side.

33.title: Saved by the Bell
33.plot: The Critic reviews a few of the more famous "Saved by the Bell" episodes, including the drug episode, the oil episode, and the "Behind the Music" episode.

34.title: Tom and Jerry: The Movie
34.plot: A longtime Tom and Jerry fan, the Critic is devastated to hear the cat and mouse not only talk, but sing, dance, and get along.

35.title: Top 11 Saddest Nostalgic Moments
35.plot: The Critic lists the movie and television scenes that still make him cry.

36.title: Nostalgia Chick Winner!
36.plot: The Critic announces the winner of the Nostalgia Chick contest, and offers the two runners-up their own shows as well.

37.title: Surf Ninjas
37.plot: The Critic insists that the seemingly-cliché-ridden and poorly-constructed "Surf Ninjas" is actually a work of genius.

38.title: NC vs. AVGN Showdown
38.plot: The Nerd apologizes to the Critic for the feud...but the two are quickly back to their old ways as the Nerd dares the Critic to come down and take him face to face.

39.title: Top 11 Nostalgic Animated Shows
39.plot: The Critic recounts the top eleven cartoons from his childhood that he thinks still hold up today.

40.title: Kazaam
40.plot: The Critic attacks "Kazaam", for its implications of slavery, pedophilia, and Shaq's horrible acting and rapping.

41.title: AVGN vs. NC Final Battle
41.plot: The Critic and the Nerd duke it out in the Nerd's basement.

42.title: Drew Struzan Tribute
42.plot: The Critic praises the work of Hollywood's most famous poster artist.

43.title: Halloween '08 Special
43.plot: The Critic negatively reviews the Teddy Ruxpin doll. The doll doesn't like that. Not...one...bit.

44.title: Double Dragon
44.plot: The Critic reviews the Double Dragon movie, which makes a lot less sense than the plot of the game.

45.title: Top 11 Underrated Nostalgia Classics
45.plot: The Critic remembers some movies so we don't have to... but maybe we want to remember these ones.

46.title: Howard the Duck
46.plot: The Critic reviews George Lucas' notorious Marvel Comics adaptation.

47.title: Mortal Kombat: Annihilation
47.plot: After receiving complaints about his review of the first Mortal Kombat movie, the Critic turns his sights on the more-universally-hated sequel...but not before bidding farewell to a very close friend: his beard.

48.title: Godzilla
48.plot: The Critic reviews Roland Emmerich's Godzilla remake, noting that, like all of Emmerich's films, the ad campaign was far more impressive than the movie.

49.title: Top 11 Disney Villains
49.plot: The Critic counts down the most badass villains the Mouse House ever gave us.

50.title: Super Mario Brothers Super Show
50.plot: The Critic remembers the illogical Super Mario cartoon, including the obnoxious Zelda segment.

51.title: Top 12 Greatest Christmas Specials
51.plot: The Critic recalls his top 12 favorite Christmas movies and specials. Why top 12? Because it's Christmas.

52.title: Jingle All the Way
52.plot: The Critic's post-holiday depression hits its peak when he has to review "Jingle All The Way".

1.title: Nicktoons
1.plot: The Critic declares January Nickelodeon Month and reviews some of the channel's first original animated series.

2.title: Nickcoms
2.plot: The Critic continues Nickelodeon month with a look at You Can't Do That on Television, Clarissa Explains it All, Hey Dude, and Salute Your Shorts, each of which he finds mostly bland but harmless. He wishes there was a kids show that was innovative and funny...and then, to his joy, he remembers Pete and Pete.

3.title: Snick
3.plot: The Critic continues Nick Month with a look at the Snick lineup, including Roundhouse, Are You Afraid of the Dark?, All That, Prometheus and Bob, Action League Now!, and Kenan & Kel.

4.title: Good Burger
4.plot: The Critic wraps up Nickelodeon month with a look into the realms of torturous insanity that is Good Burger.

5.title: FernGully: The Last Rainforest
5.plot: The Critic starts to review FernGully, but the Nostalgia Chick claims she was going to first.

6.title: A Kid in King Arthur's Court
6.plot: The Critic tries knocking himself unconscious to forget "A Kid in King Arthur's Court".

7.title: The Good Son
7.plot: The Critic reviews a movie so bad it made him lose his voice: The Good Son.

8.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
8.plot: The Critic reviews the two cartoons based on the Sonic series, each of which gets a very different reaction out of him.

9.title: Top 11 Nostalgic Mindfucks
9.plot: The Critic looks back at some of the weird stuff our childhood entertainment subjected us to.

10.title: Twister
10.plot: The Critic is appalled by the scientific inaccuracies of the movie Twister.

11.title: The Garbage Pail Kids Movie
11.plot: The Critic has finally found a movie with no redeeming value whatsoever: The Garbage Pail Kids Movie.

12.title: Rock-A-Doodle
12.plot: The Critic notes the start of Don Bluth's decline with Rock-A-Doodle.

13.title: Titanic: The Animated Movie
13.plot: The Critic reviews Titanic: The Legend Goes On, an Italian-animated movie that not only rips off James Cameron's movie and every animated movie ever made, it also includes the horrors of the Rapping Dog.

14.title: The Pagemaster
14.plot: The Critic looks at how a movie meant to inspire reading can be uninteresting by reviewing one that he's completely forgotten.

15.title: The NeverEnding Story
15.plot: For April Fools Day, Chester sits in for the Critic to review the greatest movie he's ever seen in his life.

16.title: Moonwalker
16.plot: The Critic looks at the cinematic manifestation of Michael Jackson's ego, and finds it all stupid...except for the awesome Smooth Criminal music video.

17.title: Top 11 Dumbest Superman Moments
17.plot: The Critic loves the Superman movies...well, two of them...but has to admit they have their fair share of stupidity.

18.title: TMNT
18.plot: The Critic gives into the pressure and reviews the latest Ninja Turtles movie.

19.title: Red Sonja
19.plot: After apologizing for his comments about Mako, the Critic looks at Schwarzenegger's personal favorite punchline, Red Sonja.

20.title: TGWTG Team Brawl, 1st Anniversary Video
20.plot: It's the one-year anniversary of ThatGuyWithTheGlasses.com, and the Critic and Nerd are at it again...and this time they've brought reinforcements.

21.title: Short Circuit 1 and 2
21.plot: The Critic reviews the Short Circuit movies, which he admits he likes despite their eighties cheese.

22.title: Old vs. New: Batman vs. the Dark Knight
22.plot: The Critic compares two of his favorite movies: Tim Burton's Batman, and Christopher Nolan's The Dark Knight.

23.title: Full House
23.plot: The Critic looks at the series premiere and finale of Full House, and makes a shocking discovery about the Olsen Twins.

24.title: North
24.plot: The Critic reviews Rob Reiner's biggest failure, North, a movie that Roger Ebert "hate, hate, hated!"

25.title: Critic and Nerd: TMNT Making of Coming Out of Their Shells
25.plot: The Critic and the Nerd put aside their differences and unite over their love of the Ninja Turtles to review the lowest point in the Turtles' popularity: Their rock concert tour.

26.title: Sidekicks
26.plot: The Critic attacks the cult of Chuck Norris, as well as Norris' biggest vanity project, Sidekicks.

27.title: Gargoyles
27.plot: The Critic does another positive review, this time of Disney's Gargoyles animated series.

28.title: Transformers 2
28.plot: The Critic returns to the style of his pilot episode with his review of the "adequately satisfying" Transformers 2.

29.title: Steel
29.plot: The Critic returns to the depths of Shaq's acting with this DC Comic adaptation.

30.title: Top 11 Cereal Mascots
30.plot: The Critic counts down the most memorable cereal mascots...except for The Flintstones.

31.title: Barb Wire
31.plot: The Critic reviews a Pamela Anderson vehicle that has a vaguely familiar plot.

32.title: Old vs. New: LOTR Animated vs. Lord of the Rings
32.plot: The Critic compares Ralph Bakshi and Peter Jackson's adaptations of JRR Tolkien's classic.

33.title: Last Action Hero
33.plot: The Critic reviews Schwarzenegger and John McTiernan's attempt at self-parody, finding it odd that a movie based on the difference between "the real world" and "the movie world" has such an unrealistic "real world".

34.title: Captain N: The Game Master
34.plot: The Critic reviews yet another Nintendo cash-in, the animated series about a boy who meets a bunch of characters who barely resemble the games they're based on.

35.title: We're Back! A Dinosaur Story
35.plot: Raoul Puke, father of Fozzie Journalism, sits in for the Critic and reviews this drug trip of a movie.

36.title: Warriors of Virtue
36.plot: The Critic takes on the dull Warriors of Virtue, which he only enjoys due to the over-the-top villain.

37.title: Captain America
37.plot: The Critic reviews one of the movie adaptations of Captain America and introduces the concept of the "Psyche-Hitler".

38.title: Top 11 Nostalgia Critic Fuckups
38.plot: Douchey McNitpick, the Critic's most annoying fan, points out mistakes from previous episodes.

39.title: Alone in the Dark
39.plot: The Critic finally gives in and checks out a film by Uwe Boll, which leaves him quite literally speechless. He takes comfort that he's in no condition to review the movie...but Spoony and Linkara have his back.

40.title: Blank Check
40.plot: The Critic teaches a class on "Bland Shit 101", using Disney's Blank Check as the curriculum.

41.title: Old vs. New: Willy Wonka
41.plot: The Critic compares adaptations of Roald Dahl's "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory". He may be a bit biased, as he doesn't tend to care for Tim Burton's re-imaginings.

42.title: Cool as Ice
42.plot: The Critic is almost paralyzed with laughter as he begins to review the whitest movie of all time, Cool as Ice.

43.title: Suburban Commando
43.plot: The Critic looks at Hulk Hogan's uninspired sci-fi comedy Suburban Commando, which provides a very quotable line courtesy of Christopher Lloyd: "I was FRO-zen to-day!"

44.title: The Next Karate Kid
44.plot: The Critic observes Mr. Miyagi's inexplicable changes in character in The Next Karate Kid.

45.title: Casper
45.plot: Tired of being the "friendly" ghost, Casper decides to haunt the Critic on Halloween by subjecting him to his first live-action feature...but the Critic is ready to fight back.

46.title: Superman IV
46.plot: Linkara tries to take over the show, but the Critic steps in angrily and makes them review the movie together...which he instantly regrets upon realizing the movie is Superman IV.

47.title: Congo
47.plot: The Critic looks at a stupid Michael Crichton adaptation that is only salvaged by the brief appearances of Bruce Campbell and Ernie Hudson.

48.title: A Tribute to Siskel and Ebert
48.plot: The Critic pays homage to HIS favorite critics, Gene Siskel and Roger Ebert.

49.title: Judge Dredd
49.plot: The Critic looks at one of his favorite guilty pleasures, Judge Dredd.

50.title: Tank Girl
50.plot: The Critic reviews another horrible comic book movie and notes how many starving children could have been saved with the film's budget.

51.title: Jack Frost
51.plot: The Critic reviews the stupid Michael Keaton holiday family comedy Jack Frost, wishing instead that the movie was about a chained-up Superman wearing Batman's mask.

52.title: He-Man and She-Ra: A Christmas Special
52.plot: The Critic tries to refrain from gay jokes as he watches He-Man and She-Ra share a holiday.

53.title: Return of the Christmas Specials
53.plot: After counting down his twelve favorite Christmas specials the year before, the Critic returns with the next eleven on his list.

54.title: The Star Wars Holiday Special
54.plot: The Critic reviews the worst holiday special of all time. The previously unreleased, cult fan-based Star Wars Holiday Special.

55.title: Ernest Saves Christmas
55.plot: The Critic looks at another guilty pleasure of his, filled with stupid humor, obnoxious characters...and the best Santa Claus he's ever seen.

1.title: Commando
1.plot: The Critic kicks off Schwarzenegger Month with another guilty pleasure, Commando.

2.title: Junior
2.plot: The Critic reviews Junior, a comedy so boring he has a hallucinatory dream sequence.

3.title: Conan: Part 1
3.plot: The Critic finds the first Conan movie silly, but enjoyable.

4.title: Conan: Part 2
4.plot: The Critic moves on to Conan the Destroyer, which he finds much stupider.

5.title: End of Days
5.plot: The Critic wraps up Schwarzenegger Month with End of Days, which isn't as scary as it should be...except for the cat.

6.title: The 100th Episode: Battlefield Earth
6.plot: The Critic celebrates 100 reviews by subjecting us to a crummy-ass clip show...but the clips turn on him and force him to watch Battlefield Earth.

7.title: Bebe's Kids
7.plot: After the game based on Bebe's Kids had tortured him so much, the Critic looks at the movie itself.

8.title: Lost in Space
8.plot: The Critic tries to hide from the Lost in Space movie, which manages to be even worse than the TV show it was based on.

9.title: Top 11 Villain Songs
9.plot: The Critic knows that the bad guy always gets the coolest musical number, and these are his favorites.

10.title: Quest for Camelot
10.plot: The Critic reviews Warner Brothers' attempt to cash in on the Disney musical formula.

11.title: Old vs. New: The Nutty Professor
11.plot: The Critic compares Jerry Lewis and Eddie Murphy's turns as the awkward professor who transforms himself into Buddy Love.

12.title: Bio-Dome
12.plot: The Critic hates Bio-Dome, and in this review, explains why.

13.title: The NeverEnding Story II: The Next Chapter
13.plot: The Critic looks at the sequel to one of his favorite childhood movies.

14.title: Top 11 Most Awkward Christopher Walken Moments
14.plot: The Critic counts down Christopher Walken's most awkward scenes...but keeps getting interrupted by phone calls from the man himself.

15.title: Flubber
15.plot: The Critic reviews Flubber, a disastrous remake of a classic Disney movie starring Robin Williams and is shocked to learn that it was written by the late John Hughes.

16.title: Home Alone 3
16.plot: The Nostalgia Critic reviews the movie Home Alone 3, discusses it's faults, and ridicules John Hughes.

17.title: 'Ask That Guy' Violates Ma-Ti
17.plot: The Critic has lost his voice again, and shows a disturbing video to make up for it.

18.title: Old vs. New: King Kong
18.plot: The Critic compares Peter Jackson's epic 2005 remake of King Kong with the classic 1933 original.

19.title: Drop Dead Fred
19.plot: The Critic decides to look at one of his favorite actors in one of his least favorite movies.

20.title: The Care Bears Movie
20.plot: Yup, the Critic has given in and will be reviewing The Care Bears Movie. He finds it to be the insipid, ball of multi-colored fluff its reputation paints it to be.

21.title: Kickassia Part 1: The Withering Eye
21.plot: In Part 1, the Critic learns of the existence of a micro-nation in the Nevada desert and gathers his fellow reviewers to plot an invasion.

22.title: Kickassia Part 2: Triumph and Treacle
22.plot: The reviewers make another attempt to take over Molossia, but are kept at bay by Baugh and his magic word. Finally, 2D Lee becomes 3D Lee and kicks Baugh's ass, causing him to retreat, so thus, Molossia becomes Kickassia.

23.title: Kickassia Part 3: Inglorious Glory
23.plot: Rollo-T conducts interviews with various personnel of Kickassia as they discuss their new duties, such as LordKat selling games, MarzGurl as head of the military, Linkara has head of their CIA, and Nostalgia Chick as vice president and professional bad Sarah Palin impersonator. Only the Cinema Snob begins to chafe as the Critic proves to be an ineffectual leader. Not only that, but a receipt for a load of dynamite signed by the Critic begins to make everybody suspicious.

24.title: Kickassia Part 4: The Beginning of the End of the Beginning
24.plot: The Cinema Snob decides to try and overthrow the Critic, but is caught by Film Brain and put on trial. As a result, despite being in the minority, the Critic declares him guilty and has him exiled.

25.title: Kickassia Part 5: The Fall of the Risen
25.plot: Dr. Insano's wrath is unleashed upon the Critic, and tragedy rears its head when Santa Christ is caught in the crossfire. This gives the other critics the push they need to engage in an all-out mutiny.

26.title: Kickassia Part 6: All the Really Bad Shit Happens
26.plot: The Nostalgia Critic is violently overthrown as ruler of Kickassia and ends up giving it back to Kevin Baugh, as per Santa Christ's request. He rose from the dead three days after his murder, and so all the reviewers go back to their old lives.

27.title: Jaws 3D
27.plot: After recovering from the incident in Molossia, the Critic decides to review the worst entry in the Jaws series, with Cinema Snob breaking in to talk about Simon McCorkindale.

28.title: Free Willy
28.plot: The Critic reviews the classic 1993 family movie about a boy and his whale. While he ultimately deems it acceptable, he struggles to figure out the film's appeal, because it uses a very familiar formula. Could it perhaps be the appeal of the King of Pop?

29.title: A Troll in Central Park
29.plot: This week, the Critic has to deal with the overly-schmaltzy, overly-whimsical Troll in Central Park, the ultimate low-point in Don Bluth's career.

30.title: Theodore Rex
30.plot: The Critic looks at one of the strangest film concepts he's ever seen.

33.title: Independence Day
33.plot: The Critic looks at Roland Emmerich's 1996 box-office smash.

34.title: The Room
34.plot: The Critic ignores warnings from his fellow reviewers and reviews notorious actor Tommy Wiseau's "personal project," the disturbing yet entertaining masterpiece known as "The Room."

35.title: The Tommy Wiseau Show
35.plot: The Critic spoofs Tommy Wiseau after the latter threatened him with a copyright-infringement lawsuit for his review of "The Room."

36.title: The Phantom
36.plot: The Critic decides to look at the movie of one of the silliest superheroes ever made: The Phantom. He discusses the similarities of Raiders of the Lost Ark that the film has, gawks over the female villain, and constantly makes fun of The Phantom dressing in a purple costume.

37.title: Zeus and Roxanne
37.plot: The critic looks at a love story between a dog and a dolphin.

38.title: Animaniacs Tribute
38.plot: the Nostalgia Critic interviews Tom Ruegger, Sherri Stoner, Nathan Ruegger, Paul Rugg, and John McCann from Animaniacs in his 3 Part review. They discuss the genesis of the show, the characters, the creative aspects and anecdotes.

39.title: The Flintstones Movie
39.plot: The Nostalgia Critic was never a fan of The Flintstones cartoon, and by strange coincidence, he doesn't like the 1994 live-action movie either.

40.title: Mr. Nanny
40.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

41.title: Rocky IV
41.plot: Deciding to review the fourth film in the Rocky franchise, the Nostalgia Critic reserves special criticism for the robot Paulie receives for his birthday, the absurd plotline and the over-the-top fights.

42.title: Chairman of the Board
42.plot: The Nostalgia Critic reviews Carrot Top's incessantly annoying attempt at being a movie star, with Chairman of the Board. A terrible movie with forced, predictable gags and over-the-top performances.

43.title: The Next Top 11 Nostalgia Critic Fuckups
43.plot: No critic is perfect and are common to making mistakes in their reviews. It is time once again for the Nostalgia Critic to fess up and admit to his own collection of screw ups in his latest Top 11 list.

44.title: Pound Puppies and the Legend of Big Paw
44.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

45.title: The Pebble and the Penguin
45.plot: The Critic reviews his second least favorite Don Bluth movie: about the erroneous mating rituals of penguins.

46.title: Ernest Scared Stupid
46.plot: In his first review of "Nostalgia-ween", the Nostalgia Critic takes a look at the last Ernest movie released in theaters titled "Ernest Scared Stupid" which is really stupid.

47.title: Top 11 Scariest Performances
47.plot: Continuing the month of Nostalgia-ween, where everything is supposed to be scary, the Critic counts down the top 11 scariest performances and characters that can still send shivers down our spines.

48.title: It
48.plot: The Nostalgia critic reviews the Steven King mini-series IT.

49.title: Leprechaun
49.plot: The Cinema Snob joins the Critic as they review a subpar horror movie about a little man in grotesque make-up who is on a blood quest for gold.

50.title: My Pet Monster
50.plot: The Critic trashes the direct-to-video live action movie based on the popular '80s toy My Pet Monster. But when he tries to call the director out on the faults of the movie, it leads to a shocking ending.

51.title: Nostalgic Commercials
51.plot: Still reeling from the bashing he received at the hands of the director of "My Pet Monster," a depressed Critic decides to take a break from reviewing movies and instead reviews old nostalgic commercials.

52.title: Old vs. New: 10 Commandments vs. Prince of Egypt
52.plot: It's an Old vs. New battle of biblical proportions as the Critic compares the legendary Cecil B. DeMille epic "The Ten Commandments" with the animated musical "The Prince of Egypt," right down to who's the best God.

53.title: Thief and the Cobbler
53.plot: The Critic reviews the animated movie The Thief and the Cobbler with its bland musical numbers and lessons.

54.title: Waterworld
54.plot: The Nostalgia Critic reviews 1995's box office bust Waterworld.

55.title: Little Monsters
55.plot: the Nostalgia Critic takes a look at the 1989 family film "Little Monsters", and thinks it's difficult call it a kids movie.

56.title: Rover Dangerfield
56.plot: The Critic gets into the Christmas spirit by reviewing a semi-Christmas movie: that time Rodney Dangerfield was an animated dog. It's one-liners galore.

57.title: You're a Rotten Dirty Bastard: Christmas Special
57.plot: In this spoof of "It's a Wonderful Life," the Critic's guardian angel arrives on Earth to show him what life would be like if he was never born. And the Critic is shocked to learn that the lives of his fellow reviewers are actually better without him.

58.title: The First Couple: TMNT
58.plot: In the very first installment of 'Raiders of the Story Ark', the Critic looks back on some of his childhood heroes: the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.

1.title: The NeverEnding Story III
1.plot: For the first installment of 'Sequel Month', the Critic reviews The NeverEnding Story III. Terrible practical effects, a horrible script and even worse acting makes NeverEnding Story II look like the original.

2.title: Ferngully 2
2.plot: In the second review for "Sequel Month", The Nostalgia Critic tries to re-unite with The Nostalgia Chick to review the direct-to-video sequel. She refuses and so he must go it alone finding out that it is actually worse than the first film.

3.title: Secret of NIMH 2
3.plot: The Nostalgia Critic rants and swears on The Secret of NIMH 2 angrily reviews, complains about the movie, makes fun of the plot holes with Timmy being the hero and how it ruined the first Secret of NIMH movie.

4.title: Care Bears 2
4.plot: The Nostalgia Critic reviews 1986's Care Bears movie - A New Generation.

5.title: Dungeons and Dragons
5.plot: The Nostalgia Critic reviews 2000's Dungeons and Dragons movie.

6.title: Top 11 Dumbest Spiderman Moments
6.plot: the Nostalgia Critic counts down the top 11 dumbest moments in the Spiderman movie trilogy directed by Sam Raimi.

7.title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park
7.plot: The Nostalgia Critic reviews the worst of the Jurassic Park series in 1997's The Lost World.

8.title: Return of the Nostalgic Commercials
8.plot: It's another trip down memory lane as the Critic reviews more nostalgic commercials where he takes aim at 1-900 hotline numbers and sees some inappropriately-named products.

9.title: Inspector Gadget
9.plot: While the Critic is a big fan of the Inspector Gadget cartoon, he downright loathes this live-action effort, or lack thereof. Terrible acting, horrible editing, abysmal writing, and nothing to do with the cartoon.

10.title: Old vs. New: The Karate Kid
10.plot: In this installment of "Old vs. New," the Critic compares the original 1984 classic film, "The Karate Kid" with its 2010 remake.

11.title: The Langoliers
11.plot: The Nostalgia Critic reviews the Stephen King Miniseries The Langoliers

12.title: Airborne

13.title: Baby Geniuses
13.plot: The Nostalgia Critic tackles one of the worst kid's films of the late 1990s, "Baby Geniuses."

17.title: Top 11 Dumbasses in Distress
17.plot: The Critic examines the worst examples of those with too few positive characteristics to counter (but negative ones to heighten) the basic fact that they ultimately exist to be bailed out of trouble - over and over...

18.title: Jaws 4: The Revenge
18.plot:

19.title: Gordy
19.plot: The Nostalgia Critic reviews Gordy (1995) of which is similar to Babe (1995).

20.title: The Other Animated Titanic Movie
20.plot: The Critic is horrified to learn about the existence of another animated Titanic film, which is The Legend of the Titanic (1999), and finds it to be even worse than Titanic: The Legend Goes On... (2000).

21.title: Revenge of the Commercials
21.plot: The Critic reviews a third batch of nostalgic commercials that includes a risqué Ghostbusters toy commercial and we also find out whatever became of Zack, the self-proclaimed Lego Maniac.

22.title: Once Upon a Forest
22.plot:
Know what this is about?

23.title: Little Nemo
23.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

24.title: Old vs. New: True Grit
24.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

25.title: Suburban Knights: Part I
25.plot: The Nostalgia Critic summons all his Channel Awesome "buddies" to embark with him on a quest to uncover an ancient treasure. So they dress up as various fantasy characters and set off in two separate paths. Meanwhile, a mysterious man wearing all black seems to be watching them.

26.title: Suburban Knights: Part II
26.plot: Part II finds the Nostalgia Critic's team pitted against a flamboyant cat puppet appropriately named Cat and its irate puppeteer, while Spoony's team come across three mysterious cloaked figures called The Cloaks.

27.title: Suburban Knights: Part III
27.plot: In Part III, The Nostalgia Critic's team comes across a chair sitting in the road, which the Critic promptly calls dibs on and sits. As he relaxes in the suspicious chair, the Critic reveals a little more than everyone else cared to know, while the others battle the Cloaks on the battlefield (playground).

28.title: Suburban Knights: Part IV
28.plot: Part IV finds The Nostalgia Critic's team against the sweet yet sinister Witch Warrior, while the others lose their map and get directions from The Gatecleaner. In the process, they come across the Cloaks again and Film Brain is captured.

29.title: Suburban Knights: Part V
29.plot: In Part V, The Nostalgia Critic's team finally uncovers Chuck Jaffers, who reveals even more about the lost gauntlet, and they all wonder if this quest was even worth the bother; Film Brain is recovered, while Malachite closes in on our heroes.

30.title: Suburban Knights: Part VI
30.plot: Both teams finally find a lead on Malachite's gauntlet, only to find out it was buried right back where they started. The Nostalgia Critic's team discover what appears to be the gauntlet, only to find themselves surrounded by the Cloaks, Chuck Jaffers, Cat and the Witch Warrior. Thankfully the other team arrives in time and they all engage in an epic, hilarious joust.

31.title: Suburban Knights: Part VII
31.plot: In the final chapter of "Suburban Knights", our heroes get their asses handed to them by the all-powerful Malachite. Only one who is pure of heart can help them now. Will he do it? Will Malachite obliterate all our favorite Internet reviewers?

32.title: Transformers 3 Review
32.plot: Chester A. Bum takes the Critic to court after he accuses the Critic of ripping off his review of the latest Transformers film: "Dark of the Moon."

33.title: Milk Money
33.plot: Do you find a romantic comedy about kids picking up a prostitute and reveling in creepy awkwardness amusing? Well the Critic doesn't and proves it with his review of the creepy and awkward romantic comedy "Milk Money."

34.title: Rad
34.plot:
Know what this is about?

35.title: Duck Tales
35.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

36.title: The Care Bears Adventure in Wonderland
36.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

37.title: Cop and 1/2
37.plot: The Critic looks at the decline of Burt Reynolds' movie career, and how starring in a family action buddy-cop comedy opposite a little boy did not help it in the slightest.

38.title: Top 11 Batman: TAS Episodes
38.plot: The Critic counts down his top 11 favorite moments from the 90's Batman animated series.

39.title: Alaska
39.plot: The Critic checks out the worst thing to happen to Alaska since Sarah Palin: the movie, Alaska. The film's mean-spiritedness turns the Critic off as he doesn't gravitate toward the characters or the situation. He feels the movie takes place in Hell after it froze over.

40.title: Let's Play Bart's Nightmare
40.plot: The Critic takes an amateurish approach to Let's Plays by reviewing Bart's Nightmare.

41.title: James and the Giant Peach
41.plot: Following his Let's Play of Bart's Nightmare, The Nostalgia Critic has come under scrutiny from his "adoring" fans who have had him incarcerated in an Internet state penitentiary. In attempt to regain his fan base, The Critic agrees to do a positive review for "James and the Giant Peach", despite actually disliking the film, and is held at gun point under the threat of being shot if he dares point out any flaws. He goes on to ridicule the song lyrics, the questionable disappearance of James' parents via a wild rhino, and many other story elements that are never really...

42.title: The Avengers
42.plot: The Critic's joy at realizing that he is going to review the Avengers movie based on the Marvel Comic superheroes turns to disappointment when he finds out that the Avengers movie is actually the unrelated yet notoriously bad 1998 film.

43.title: Simon Sez
43.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

44.title: The Tommyknockers
44.plot: Why do Stephen King Mini-Series bring us so much joy?

45.title: The Haunting
45.plot: The Nostalgia Critic reviews a bad remake of one of his favorite movies, The Haunting. As he reviews it, he picks apart the story, complains about Owen Wilson's character stating the painfully obvious, and he gawks at the incredibly sexy Catherine Zeta Jones.

46.title: Blair Witch 2: Book of Shadows
46.plot: The Critic takes a look at the horrible sequel to the 1999 found-footage smash hit, The Blair Witch Project. He likes the original, but finds the sequel incoherent, horribly acted, badly edited and dreadfully acted.

47.title: Exorcist 2
47.plot: Wrapping up Nostalgia-Ween with one of the strangest sequels ever. It's time for the Exorcist II - The Heretic.

48.title: Doug's 1st Movie
48.plot: The Critic reviews "Doug's 1st Movie," a movie based on a cartoon that tormented him during his youth.

49.title: The Cell
49.plot: Before you see The Immortals, take a look at what the director made long, long before. It's The Cell.

50.title: Superman: The Animated Series
50.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

51.title: Felix the Cat: The Movie
51.plot: By popular demand from his viewers, the Critic takes on one of the worst animated movies he's ever had to review: "Felix the Cat: The Movie."

52.title: Moulin Rouge
52.plot: It's an all-star musical sensation as the Nostalgia Critic teams up with Nostalgia Chick and Brentalfloss to review the 2001 musical Moulin Rouge.

53.title: Babes in Toyland
53.plot: Keanu Reeves and Drew Barrymore? Yay. 1986? Nay.

54.title: The Grinch
54.plot: The Critic reviews The Grinch in light of the holiday season, but it's a movie he despises for some reason. Flamboyant, loud, and made to annoy, yet how does it bring the people such joy? In a Seuss-style critique, the Critic prepares to tear into The Grinch, the movie of the week.

55.title: Child's Play
55.plot: The Critic and Phelous team up to review an unlikely Christmas movie: The first Child's Play movie.

1.title: Santa Claus: The Movie
1.plot: The Critic closes out a month of reviewing Christmas movies by reviewing the bizarre yet ever-growing holiday cult classic "Santa Claus: The Movie."

2.title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
2.plot: The Critic opens "Star Trek Month" by reviewing the first Star Trek movie, a movie he calls "Star Trek: The Slow-Motion Picture" because the lack of cuts in the film left him bored out of his mind. Guest-starring Angry Joe doing his best Khan impression.

3.title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock
3.plot: "Star Trek Month" continues as the Critic reviews "Star Trek III: The Search for Spock," the only odd-numbered Trek film that comes close to actually being good.

4.title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier
4.plot: The Critic reviews "Star Trek V" and wonders why in a movie whose plot involves a mission to find God does director/writer William Shatner include a three-breasted cat lady, a musical number, and a half-naked 50-year-old woman dancing.

5.title: Star Trek: Generations
5.plot: The Critic explores the Next Generation crew's first foray into movies and is profoundly annoyed at the confusing and nonsensical subplots, most notably the exploitation of Data's emotion chip.

6.title: Star Trek: Insurrection
6.plot: Linkara finally catches up to the Critic as they close out "Star Trek Month" by reviewing what they consider to be the worst "Star Trek" film of all: "Star Trek: Insurrection."

7.title: Patch Adams
7.plot: The Critic contends with both an annoying clown doctor and the Robin Williams film "Patch Adams," which he found annoying and historically inaccurate for a movie based on a true story.

8.title: Ponyo
8.plot: The Critic shocks everyone by deciding to review the 2008 anime film "Ponyo" for his 200th episode.

9.title: Dunston Checks In
9.plot: The Critic tries to explain why movies featuring monkeys, or in this movie's case, chimps are not funny when he reviews the awful "Dunston Checks In."

10.title: Thomas and the Magic Railroad
10.plot: The Critic reviews "Thomas and the Magic Railroad," a movie based on a children's TV show he's never seen and is shocked to learn that Oscar-nominated actors Alec Baldwin and Peter Fonda are in this movie.

11.title: The Top 11 Nostalgia Critic Fuck-ups: Part 3
11.plot: Notorious Internet hater, Douchy McNitpick, returns with yet another top 11 list of all the mistakes the Critic has made.

12.title: Ri¢hie Ri¢h
12.plot: The Critic reviews yet another bad Macaulay Culkin film: "Richie Rich," a movie that, despite being released back when America still had an economy, shows us how the "1%" people live.

13.title: Jungle 2 Jungle
13.plot: The Critic explores the "Feces of the Jungle" by reviewing the Tim Allen stinker, "Jungle 2 Jungle."

14.title: Old vs New - Manhunter and Red Dragon
14.plot: For the latest installment of "Old vs. New," the Critic decides to compare two classic Hannibal Lecter movies: the 1986 thriller "Manhunter" and its 2002 remake, "Red Dragon" with Anthony Hopkins as Lecter.

15.title: Starchaser: The Legend of Orin
15.plot: Sage forces the Critic to review the cheesy 80's animated sci-fi film "Starchaser: The Legend of Orin," a movie that blatantly rips off "Star Wars."

16.title: Raiders of the Story Arc: Transformers
16.plot: Optimus Prime fills in for the Critic as he oversees the casting call for the next Transformers movie and recalls the glory days of the classic 80's Transformers cartoon series.

17.title: A Simple Wish
17.plot: The Critic makes it no secret that he's not a fan of 90s child star Mara Wilson and he reinforces that with a review of another one of her movies: A Simple Wish (1997). Unfortunately, that leads to a shocking surprise cameo appearance from the actress herself.

18.title: Alien: Resurrection
18.plot: While anticipating the summer releases of The Avengers and Prometheus, the Critic reviews the one movie that has a connection to both: Alien: Resurrection.

19.title: Jack
19.plot: Running out of material that deal with bad Robin Williams movies, The Critic finds new material when he finds out the latest movie he has to review, Jack is directed by The Godfather's Francis Ford Coppola.

20.title: Heavy Metal
20.plot: The Critic does yet another crossover review, this time with Diamanda. The movie they're reviewing? The really strange anime anthology classic, "Heavy Metal."

21.title: Mr. Magoo
21.plot: The Critic review another really bad movie adaptation of a cartoon he thinks is not funny: Disney's Mr. Magoo.

22.title: Top 11 Simpsons Episodes
22.plot: The Critic counts his top 11 favorite episodes of the long-running animated classic, The Simpsons.

23.title: Signs
23.plot: The Critic takes aim at M. Night Shyamalan when he reviews a movie he hates yet everyone else loves: Signs.

24.title: Digimon the Movie
24.plot: The Critic caves in to popular demand and reviews Digimon: The Movie based on a cartoon he knows absolutely nothing about. Luckily for him, he knows someone who does. Guest starring Jesuotaku and Angry Joe.

25.title: The Top 11 Awesome Movie Themes
25.plot: The Critic counts down his top 11 favorite movie themes of all time.

26.title: Superbabies: Baby Geniuses 2
26.plot: At a convention, two guys find the Critic comatose. As they try to revive him, he is forced to review the cause of his current state: Baby Geniuses 2.

27.title: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom
27.plot: The Critic clashes with 80's Dan and his crew over whether or not Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom is the worst Indiana Jones film ever. Guest starring Brad Jones.

28.title: The Wiz
28.plot: The Critic and Todd in the Shadows team up to do a review of The Wiz, an urban take on The Wizard of Oz featuring Michael Jackson and written by Joel Schumacher, inventor of the dreaded Bat Credit Card.

29.title: Total Recall
29.plot: Annoyed that the film Total Recall got a remake, the Critic decides to review the original Arnold Schwarzenegger classic, a movie he actually likes despite it being a Schwarzenegger film. Guest starring That Sci-Fi Guy.

30.title: Scooby-Doo
30.plot: The Critic's past, present and future selves collide causing a temporal paradox that can only be solved by reviewing the 2002 live-action adaptation of Scooby-Doo.

31.title: To Boldly Flee: Part I
31.plot: The Nostalgia Critic is still mourning the loss of his close friend and colleague, Ma-Ti. As if things weren't bad enough, he soon finds himself under house arrest, thanks to protests from Terl, the psychotic Psychlo; Paw discovers a strange entity emanating from space.

32.title: To Boldly Flee: Part II
32.plot: Government agents confiscate Spoony, while the Critic "beams up" his fellow reviewers to his house in order to put their minds together to come up with a solution to right the Critic's wrongs and find Ma-Ti and stop the current threat on the planet. In short (no offense, Mickey), they steal equipment from Dr. Insano and convert the Critic's house into a galactic cruiser.

33.title: To Boldly Flee: Part III
33.plot: The Channel Awesome crew blasts off into space aboard the U.S.S. Exit Strategy (Doug's house), bound for Europa. During the trip, the crew amuse themselves with various activities, such as Paw shooting a vlog and C.R. and JesuOtaku start building a contraption envisioned in their similar dream, and Lindsay, Todd and Lupa finally solve their love triangle; Meanwhile, Terl teams up with the jaded General Zod.

34.title: To Boldly Flee: Part IV
34.plot: Part IV finds our heroes pitted against Terl and General Zod. The Critic rescues Sage, Sad Panda and Spoony from Terl's men, only to engage in a lengthy battle of many weapons and wits. Through a series of beaming snafus, the Cinema Snob gets captured.

35.title: To Boldly Flee: Part V
35.plot: The captive Cinema Snob is tempted by the Dark Side to abandon the critics for a chance to create his own movie. Meanwhile, another crew member is assimilated by Mechakara and the Nostalgia Chick and Film Brain goes inside Spoony's head to find out the truth about the Plot Hole and Ma-Ti.

36.title: To Boldly Flee: Part VI
36.plot: The Snob turns to the "dark side"; Film Brain has a horrifying vision of the power behind all this madness, and Lupa and JewWario thwart Mechakara's attempt to eradicate the entire crew.

37.title: To Boldly Flee: Part VII
37.plot: Luke Mochrie seeks out the wise and powerful Oancitizen, who trains him in the ways of The Plot; the critics prepare for battle against the Executor's army; the Nostalgia Critic succumbs to his own feeling of self-doubt and heads for The Hole, not knowing that it's a trap!

38.title: To Boldly Flee: Part VIII
38.plot: The crap hits the fan as Luke and Snob engage in a duel of the fates; the Nostalgia Critic has an out-of-universe experience and meets his maker; Linkara arrives to save the day aboard Comicron 1, and The Executor, Terl, Zod and Mechakara are destroyed. But what about the Critic? Will he decide to enter the real world or continue on in a scripted, contrived universe?

1.title: The Odd Life of Timothy Green
1.plot: The Critic returns from the Plot Hole, ready to review again. First up on the chopping block is The Odd Life of Timothy Green, a horribly misguided 2012 family film with a mixed message about parenting and too much focus on pencils than story.

2.title: Is Twilight the Worst Thing Ever?
2.plot: The Critic examines the Twilight film series and determines whether or not it lives up to all the harsh, scathing criticism it receives... and when it does, he explains why.

3.title: Pearl Harbor
3.plot: As part of the "Month of Love", the Critic reviews the 2001 Michael Bay historical drama about the event that led to America's involvement in World War II.

4.title: Does Romeo and Juliet Suck?
4.plot: To wrap up the "Month of Love", the Critic takes a look at the world's most popular love story, Romeo and Juliet, analyzing all the movie adaptations and determining whether or not it deserves to be as beloved as it is.

5.title: Son of the Mask
5.plot: Satan searches for the right movie to put his daughter back on the right path, but unfortunately for him, the Nostalgia Critic gets his hands on it first. The infamous, 2005 Carrey-less sequel to The Mask: Son of the Mask. Having to endure the frightening imagery, asinine plot and horrible performances nearly scares the Critic half out of his wits.

6.title: What the F**K Was Up with Where the Wild Things Are?
6.plot: The 2009 live action film adaptation of Maurice Sendak's classic children's book is critiqued by The Critic in an 'Editorial' episode of the series.

7.title: The King and I
7.plot: Critic reviews the 1999 animated adaptation of The King and I. He criticizes the lack of loyalty to the source material and too much attention focused on cartoonish side characters. On the side, he addresses fan complaints about the color of the wall.

8.title: What's with the Princess Hate?
8.plot: What's up with all the hate towards princesses these days? Are they really such bad role models for little girls? Well, the Nostalgia Critic is here to get to the bottom of this quandary with surprising results.

9.title: Catwoman
9.plot: Catwomen Anonymous seeks out The Nostalgia Critic and forces him to include them in his review of the 2004 flop Catwoman. Despite what the Catwomen think, it was not the fault of Halle Berry the film failed, as the Critic actually praises her performance.

10.title: Farewell to Roger Ebert
10.plot: The Critic pays tribute, and even delivers a eulogy to his idol, famed film critic Roger Ebert.

11.title: The Looney Tunes Show: Good or Bad?
11.plot: Does the new Looney Tunes Show stay true to the Golden Age Warner Bros. cartoons of old; or is it yet another uninspired schlock-fest made to cash-in on our childhoods? That's what the Nostalgia Critic is here to find out.

12.title: The Cat in the Hat
12.plot: While babysitting Satan's daughter, Evilina, the Nostalgia Critic is forced to watch one of the worst movies ever made, The Cat in the Hat. Frightening images, adult humor and lack of loyalty to Seuss' work really grind the Critic's gears.

13.title: Did Seinfeld Lie to Us?
13.plot: The Critic looks at two shows, Seinfeld and Louie, that are seemingly "about nothing." When comparing the two, Seinfeld had more substance, so were they being honest when they said it was a show about nothing?

14.title: Top 11 South Park Episodes
14.plot: By popular demand, and despite a trio of nitpickers poised over their keyboards, ready to hate, the Critic counts down his top 11 favorite South Park episodes.

15.title: Is Parody Dead?
15.plot: Have you seen the latest spoof movies? They all suck, don't they? What happened to parody movies as an art; and when did spoof start to equal cesspool of references? The Nostalgia Critic intends to find that out.

16.title: Jurassic Park
16.plot: In a controversial move, the Nostalgia Critic reviews a good movie: Jurassic Park. He points out the flaws that people didn't notice before, he worships the T-Rex as the silver screen's biggest hero, and he says it has held up well these past 20 years.

17.title: Why Is Loki So Hot?
17.plot: Really, girls? Thor's evil, immature but powerful and merciless brother is the object of your affections? What is it about Loki that sets the ladies' hearts aflutter? Maybe the Nostalgia Critic can get to the bottom of this.

18.title: A.I: Artificial Intelligence
18.plot: When the Nostalgia Critic takes one too many pot shots at TMZ, they decide to employ him. While the other reporters run around obtaining pointless, mindless mundane celebrity gossip, the Critic reviews A.I.

19.title: Are Video Games Art?
19.plot: Being a semi-casual gamer himself, the Critic decides to find an answer to that age-old question: are video games art? He studies the evolution of games as an art form and finds there is more than meets the eye.

20.title: Master of Disguise
20.plot: The Critic reviews The Master of Disguise, a horrendous, ill-conceived and unfunny comedy featuring an obnoxious performance by Dana Carvey and produced by Adam Sandler's infamous garbage factory, Happy Madison.

21.title: What Does the Secret of NIMH Mean?
21.plot: For this week's editorial, the Nostalgia Critic explores all the themes of one of his favorite movies of all time, The Secret of NIMH, and is determined to find out just what that secret is.

22.title: Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie
22.plot: In honor of the Power Rangers' 20th anniversary, Zordon summons the Nostalgia Critic to outwit Rita Repulsa and review Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie. It's a listless, shameful, advertisement whore of a ride, but someone's got to do it.

23.title: Are Superheroes Whiny Little Bitches?
23.plot: Are Superheroes Whiny Little Bitches? Why have they been transformed from brave, strong, bad-asses into mopey little emos? The Nostalgia Critic digs deep into superhero mythos to find out why.

24.title: Top 11 Dumbest Lord of the Rings Moments
24.plot: Even a perfect trilogy of movies like The Lord of the Rings is bound to have its share of stupid, dumb-ass moments, which is why The Nostalgia Critic has compiled a list of his personal top 11. Hi-jinx to follow.

25.title: Is it Right to Nitpick?
25.plot: To the shock of absolutely no one, the Nostalgia Critic admits to being a nitpicker. However, there is a method to this madness as the Critic explores the need to nitpick, when it's appropriate, and determines how much is too much.

26.title: Was Batman Season 4 Hit or Miss?
26.plot: The Critic talks about the fourth season of Batman: The Animated Series, or rather the first season of The New Batman Adventures. He compares and contrasts looks and environments, and agrees that when all is said and done, the Joker's new design looks like hell.

27.title: Sailor Moon
27.plot: The Nostalgia Critic looks back on the mid-'90s Anime sensation, Sailor Moon. It's your basic, run-of-the-mill Japanese animated kids show, and to the Critic's dismay, he realizes he's been ogling scantily-clad 14-year-old girls, albeit animated ones, all this time.

28.title: Why Is Tom and Jerry Genius?
28.plot: Before Itchy and Scratchy, we had Tom and Jerry as the ultimate cat and mouse disaster team. Why were they truly the masters of animated slapstick and why are they not as popular today? Who better to find out than a real-life cartoon character: the Nostalgia Critic.

29.title: Les Misérables: Musical Review
29.plot: The Critic, Paw and Oancitizen review the 2012 hit musical Les Miserables. Paw loves it, Oan hates it, and the Critic is somewhere between. Not only that, but the review is constantly hindered by guest stars Brentalfloss and Todd in the Shadows; Maven and Paw start a fling, and Linkara feels left out of the whole thing.

30.title: Nostalgia Critic's Top 11 Adult Jokes We Never Got as Kids
30.plot: While the Critic is busy making his latest epic, explosive review for next week, he manages to compile a Top 11 list of jokes from movies and cartoons we probably didn't get in our first viewings as children.

31.title: The Last Airbender
31.plot: The Critic is called upon by the Waterbenders to review the abysmal movie adaptation of Avatar: The Last Airbender, to help save the franchise. The Critic discovers what he already expected: the movie makes every mistake in the book.

32.title: WTF Is with the Ending of the Graduate?
32.plot: Was the ending to The Graduate happy or more bittersweet? Did our hero win in the end, or wind up in more trouble? The Nostalgia Critic decides to get to the bottom of this with a thorough analysis of the film and its underlying themes.

33.title: Bridge to Terabithia
33.plot: The Nostalgia Critic keeps his promise to review Bridge to Terabithia. He finds it to be an overly whimsical, atypical and bland film, with a juvenile female lead character who is a borderline obsessive psychotic.

34.title: Is the Big Lebowski a Masterpiece?
34.plot: Is the 1998 Coen Brothers' comedy really the masterpiece it is perceived to be? Is it just a comedy about oddball characters in ludicrous situations, or is there much, much more beneath the surface to be studied? The Nostalgia Critic decides to find out.

35.title: The Shining Mini-Series
35.plot: Nostalgiaween returns, and what better way to mark the occasion than another Stephen King mini-series? First up is The Shining. The Critic feels it's mundane and monotonous, as opposed to the 1980 Kubrick version. Needless to say, Stan wins...or does he?

36.title: Why Do We Love Zombies?
36.plot: Seriously, what is it about walking corpses who crave human brains that excites and intrigues us so? For his first Nostalgiaween editorial, the Critic investigates the latest zombie craze to determine their true appeal.

37.title: Sharknado
37.plot: The Cinema Snob visits the Critic to help him figure out why Sharknado is such a runaway success, given how crappy of a film it is. So the two review the movie to find out why, as well as come up with gimmicky schlock film ideas of their own.

38.title: Should We Scare the S#*% Out of Kids?
38.plot: The Nostalgia Critic finally addresses the age-old mystery of why so many children's movies have such scary imagery, and what is the purpose of making them wet their pants in fear? He finds there may be more to it than just being scary for scary sake.

39.title: Devil
39.plot: Nostalgiaween 2013 concludes with The Nostalgia Critic finding himself trapped on an elevator with, of all people, Rita Repulsa, Santa Christ, and Satan himself. To pass the time, they review the 2010 Shyamalan vehicle Devil, which may or may not reflect their current situation.

40.title: How Come Super Mario Comics Don't Suck?
40.plot: Mama Mia! Super Mario Bros. comics are actually pretty good? How come Mario and Luigi have faltered in movies and TV shows, but not in printed media? Quite the bamboozling mystery, but the Nostalgia Critic intends to get to the bottom of this.

41.title: Dawn of the Commercials
41.plot: In his 'I Donut Donuts' T-shirt, the Nostalgia Critic plops down on the couch to review more commercials, including patriotic pancakes, Toys R Us kids who probably never grew up, disgusting twin baby dolls and a few controversial PSA's. Also, the Wicked Witch of the West tries her luck at seduction.

42.title: Has CGI Gone Too Far?
42.plot: The Nostalgia Critic discusses the pros and cons of CGI effects in movies, in which cases they're necessary and when they're not. He compares it to practical effects in older movies, determining the true appeal of both and when one should be used instead of the other.

43.title: Man of Steel
43.plot: The Nostalgia Critic and Angry Joe team up to review the one superhero movie that half the internet loved and the other half hated: Man of Steel. Critic hates it, Joe loves it, and they go over the movie, beat by beat, to determine which side is right.

44.title: Top 12 Santa Clauses
44.plot: It's Christmas time again, and to kick off this holly jolly season, the Nostalgia Critic, an avid lover of Christmas, lists off his Top 12 best Santa Clauses from movies and TV specials. Why 12? Because it's Christmas.

45.title: Eight Crazy Nights
45.plot: How well does Adam Sandler hold up in animated form? Less bearable than in human form. The Nostalgia Critic reviews Sandler's 2002 foray into animation as the world's only well-known Hanukkah movie, which could possibly be the worst holiday special the Critic has ever seen...this year.

46.title: Why Lie About Santa?
46.plot: Is it really a good idea to lie to your kids about the existence of Santa Claus? This may sound like a damaging topic, but don't worry. The Nostalgia Critic finds out that if one generation realizes the truth about Santa, they can still keep the magic alive for the next generation, and that in this instance, under these circumstances, it's okay to lie.

47.title: The Worst Christmas Special Ever!
47.plot: The Nostalgia Critic reviews what he considers to be the WORST holiday special he's ever seen: from 1991, The Christmas Tree. How bad is it? Simply put, it makes The Star Wars Holiday Special look like It's a Wonderful Life.

48.title: Why Is Arthur Christmas a Masterpiece?
48.plot: Remember that bizarre animated British Christmas film from 2011 called Arthur Christmas? Few people do, which is a shame because, as the Nostalgia Critic finds out, that film is pretty much an underrated gem. But why? The Critic intends to find that out as well.

1.title: Face/Off
1.plot: It's January, which means Nicolas Cage Month. The Critic starts the ball rolling with John Woo's horrifically outrageously overdone, but so-bad-it's-good, Face/Off. He enjoys what a loose canon Cage is in the film, and John Travolta is no slouch in the overacting department either. Also, Critic and Malcolm have to say farewell to Rachel, who's moved on to bigger and better things.

2.title: When Is Something So Bad It's Good?
2.plot: The Nostalgia Critic breaks down the expression "so bad, it's good" by examining how some films can be so incredibly bad and yet still be entertaining, while on the other hand, other films are really bad and not entertaining at all. His findings may shock you.

3.title: The Wicker Man
3.plot: Nic Cage month continues with Neil DeBute's unnecessary 2006 remake of The Wicker Man. It's...well, it's got Nicolas Cage with his brand of humor, and it's a very, very weird movie. There are killer trucks and bees in it too. Also, Critic meets creepy girl Tamara.

4.title: Ghost Rider
4.plot: Nicolas Cage month concludes with the 2007 devilishly awful Ghost Rider. It's Cage in all his Cagey goodness as he tries to portray that flaming skull who snatches souls for Satan.

5.title: Top 11 Strangest (Yet Best) Couples
5.plot: Valentine's Day is right around the corner, and to mark the occasion, the Critic looks at the Top 11 Strangest (and yet best) Couples the big and small screens have to offer.

6.title: Ghost Dad
6.plot: The Nostalgia Critic's "ghost" reviews the horrendous 1990 Bill Cosby flick Ghost Dad. It seems Cosby could never catch a break with his movie career, and this film is no exception. Implausible rules of the after-life, bad acting, bad writing, this movie never stood a ghost of a chance.

7.title: When Is a Movie Just a Movie?
7.plot: Why do people throw conniption fits over movies that don't turn out the way they'd like? It's just a movie. Right? Well, the Nostalgia Critic is here to investigate this shocking turn of events by delving into the history of film to discover exactly how, when and why we became so invested.

8.title: Are You Sick of "Let It Go?"
8.plot: Seriously, what is it about that Frozen song that everybody just loves? The Nostalgia Critic and Tamara sing about the song, trying to figure out its true meaning and why it's "everybody's crystal meth."

9.title: Alice in Wonderland
9.plot: The Critic chases a black rabbit down a hole and winds up in the curious world of Burtonland. To find his way out, he is assisted by the sweet, but dangerous Malice, and to pass the time, the Critic reviews the hack, clichéd 2010 Tim Burton Alice in Wonderland.

10.title: Top 11 Things You Never Noticed About Ghostbusters
10.plot: Think you know the smash-hit Ghostbusters pretty well? Seen it a million times and memorized the film beat by beat? Well, as the Nostalgia Critic is here to point out, there may be 1 or 2...or 11 things you might have never noticed before.

11.title: Disney Afternoon
11.plot: The Critic embraces his inner child as he and his friends gather round to relive the fond memories of the Disney Afternoon. DuckTales, Chip'N Dale, Darkwing Duck, TaleSpin, Gargoyles, Snookums and Meat, and all the classics are remembered, some more fondly than others.

12.title: What You Never Knew About Batman
12.plot: The Critic looks at Tim Burton's smash hit Batman, a beloved classic to superhero fans and action movie fans alike, however he's here to look at what the fans haven't noticed before. One or two or 16 things that may have avoided your gaze when you saw this movie last.

13.title: Foodfight!
13.plot: So how bad could an animated movie centered around various food product mascots be? The Nostalgia Critic decides to hop on the bandwagon and review the 2012 animated flop Foodfight - only to discover that it is a movie from the deepest, darkest bowels of corporate hell, and the Anti-Christ of animation.

14.title: Top 11 GOOD Things from the Star Wars Prequels
14.plot: The Nostalgia Critic has actually managed to find 11 things that the Star Wars prequels actually did right. Yes, there are 11 of them, and yes, these are the things most haters actually overlook.

15.title: The Swan Princess
15.plot: The Critic pops open another can of Diet Disney to review the 1994 animated musical, The Swan Princess. He points out the poor character development, Disney rip-offs and needless musical numbers. After this, the Critic swears off Diet Disney for good, but in the process, stumbles across a bottle of Seuss Zero.

16.title: What You Never Knew About Roger Rabbit
16.plot: Toons. Or in this case, just one: that lovable, stuttering oaf Roger Rabbit. The movie is a timeless gem that everybody has seen more times than they can count, however, there may be a few things you may have never noticed, and the Nostalgia Critic is here to point out 15 of them.

17.title: The Lorax
17.plot: Time to speak for the Seuss as the Critic reviews the horrible 2012 cash-in on the good doctor's book that was against corporate greed, but the movie chooses to embrace it. Nothing but clichés galore, a poorly represented protagonist, and endless pop culture references, and somehow, it was still a big hit. The Critic intends to find out why.

18.title: Why Do We Love Stupid?
18.plot: We seem to enjoy really stupid things. But there are different kinds: that which is funny, that which is not and that which is unexpected. Why do we laugh at some things and not others? The Nostalgia Critic will get to the bottom of this.

19.title: Old vs New - Spider-Man
19.plot: Old vs. New returns as the Critic compares the 2002 Spider-Man film series to the newer one. Which one was better? Which Spidey was better? Which villains were better? And will the Critic ever pacify that Hyper Fangirl of his?

20.title: Is Juno Any Damn Good?
20.plot: Remember the 2007 cult classic Juno? Everybody loved it, then everybody hated it, and it was talked about endlessly for months after. What was the appeal? The Nostalgia Critic analyzes this quirky teen-pregnancy comedy to find out.

21.title: Blues Brothers 2000
21.plot: Remember the unnecessary 1998 sequel to the Blues Brothers? No? Well the Critic wishes he were so lucky as he is forced to relive every unfunny joke, forced musical number and forgettable characters. Yeah, they're on a mission -from Satan.

22.title: What You Never Knew About Gremlins
22.plot: We're all familiar with Gremlins, right? Don't feed after midnight, no direct sunlight and don't get them wet? Well there are a few more things we didn't know about them, and the Nostalgia Critic is here to point out all 18 of them.

23.title: Jurassic Park III
23.plot: At long last, it's time to review Jurassic Park III, the low point of the trilogy, so far. The Critic is dismayed to find Grant and Sattler's relationship retconned, the M.F.ing T-Rex biting the dust, and Tea Leoni's teeth-gratingly annoying performance. While he thinks the movie is stupid, he does praise its short running time.

24.title: After Earth
24.plot: The Nostalgia Critic reviews "After Earth", Will Smith's vanity project that he hoped would make a star out of his son. Things didn't quite go as planned.

25.title: Nostalgia Critic Talks Transformers 4
25.plot: True to form, the Critic jumps in to talk about the latest Transformers movie, warning potential moviegoers that they're in for the exact same thing as before, and that Michael Bay has systematically castrated all his male viewers.

26.title: Is Tree of Life Full of Shit?
26.plot: The Critic looks at Tree of Life, that colorful mish-mosh movie about family dilemmas...and dinosaurs. He analyzes how much a film should be left open to interpretation and when it is and isn't appropriate to not follow the three-act structure.

27.title: BloodRayne
27.plot: The Three Schmuckheads: Critic, Linkara and Spoony reunite for another Uwe Boll travesty. This time it's BloodRayne, Boll's little outing into the vampire phenomenon. It's dark, violent and makes no freakin' sense, but the boys still have a blast sucking it dry.

28.title: What You Never Knew About Hot Fuzz
28.plot: The Critic looks at that 2007 satirical British comedy about that long, shaky arm of the law, and finds 14 different things that regular viewers of the movie may very well have missed.

29.title: The Purge
29.plot: The Critic balks at the 2013 horror thriller The Purge. He points out how illogical the whole idea is and how serious the movie takes it. He does however relish the over-acting villain. Meanwhile, a maniacal Film Brain demands the Critic do a crossover with him, lest he destroy the entire studio.

30.title: Top 11 Best Film Trailers
30.plot: Despite WatchMojo recently putting out a Top 10 Trailers video themselves, the Critic says screw that and releases his own, naming his Top 11 choices for best movie trailers. Why Top 11? Because he likes to go one step beyond (WatchMojo).

31.title: Small Soldiers
31.plot: The Critic reviews Small Soldiers, a film that is essentially what would happen if you threw Toy Story and Gremlins into a blender: the perfect recipe for late '90s clichéd, sado-masochist nightmare fuel, as only Joe Dante can make.

32.title: What You Never Knew About Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
32.plot: Cowabunga, dudes and dudettes. The totally gnarly Nostalgia Critic looks back on the original 1990 bodacious Ninja Turtles flick, and points out 15 radical factoids about this awesome film you totally never saw before.

33.title: The Princess Diaries 2: Royal Engagement
33.plot: Hyper Fangirl coaxes the Nostalgia Critic to her 'humble' abode to make him review Princess Diaries 2: Royal Boogaloo with her. The movie is a stupid, cliché-ridden waste of time, but the Critic feels he must endure...lest he be picked off by the assassin who keeps following him around.

34.title: Does "American Beauty" Still Hold Up?
34.plot: The Critic analyzes the 1999 award-winning American Beauty. It's just an innocent, laid-back late-90s flick about the conflicting view points of young and old, right? The Critic discovers there's more than meets the eye.

35.title: Ghost Rider 2: Spirit of Vengeance
35.plot: The Critic gears up to review Ghost Rider 2, when suddenly local British Person Mike J. cuts in and demands he review the film with him. It's a poorly shot movie with overused special effects, but at least they get to see ol' Nicolas Cage-out as only he can.

36.title: Top 11 Worst Avatar Episodes
36.plot: Sure, the Nostalgia Critic is a big fan of Avatar: The Last Airbender. But all good shows have their share of bad episodes, and so the Critic decides to count down his personal Top 11 worst.

37.title: Top 11 Best Avatars
37.plot: The Nostalgia Critic, along with special guest and Avatar veteran Dante Basco go through their personal choices for the Top 11 Best Avatar Episodes.

38.title: Is Eyes Wide Shut Just Artsy Porn?
38.plot: The Nostalgia Critic examines Stanley Kubrick's final film, Eyes Wide Shut. Is it just a pretentious excuse for T&A, or are there underlying themes in the imagery and character actions? The Critic digs deep below the surface to find out.

39.title: Maximum Overdrive
39.plot: Nostalgiaween 2014 kicks off true to form with a Stephen King movie. It has every King trope in the book, which the Critic knocks, only to be contradicted by the Troperaiser.

40.title: Top 11 New Halloween Classics
40.plot: The Critic does a Top 11 countdown to find a new batch of horror classics to watch on All Hallow's Eve.

41.title: Monster Squad
41.plot: The Nostalgia Critic and friends start their own little token troop as they review the "kid friendly" eighties romp Monster Squad.

42.title: Is Sleepy Hollow Secretly Brilliant?
42.plot: The Critic closes out Nostalgiaween 2014 by looking at Tim Burton's live action adaptation of Sleepy Hollow. He finds he can't make heads nor tails of it and wonders if it was intentionally supposed to be a bad film. His findings may leave you "hammered."

43.title: Rise of the Commercials
43.plot: Time for more nostalgic commercials. The Critic gears up to watch all the fun as he experiences tortured Crash Test Dummies, similar toys for girls and boys, epic laser tag, nightmare fuel Nintendo, a bizarre Diaper Surprise, Ninja Turtles galore, douching, and another Canadian gem which teaches kids not to put things in their mouths.

44.title: Is There Another Good Shyamalan Movie?
44.plot: The Critic looks at a Shyamalan movie...that he actually likes? He explains the messages that are left to interpretation, the underlying themes of good and evil, and how, even for a Shyamalan film, it's surprisingly subtle and brilliant.

45.title: Forest Warrior
45.plot: An event five years in the making comes to pass when The Nostalgia Critic and Film Brain finally team up for a crossover review. And what better way to celebrate this union than with a cheesy Chuck Norris film where he turns into a bear.

46.title: What You Never Knew About Planes, Trains & Automobiles
46.plot: Those aren't pillows. Those are 16 things about Planes, Trains and Automobiles you may have never noticed before. In light of the Thanksgiving season, the Critic analyzes one of John Hughes' best movies to show long-time viewers what they might have missed.

47.title: Grandma Got Run Over by a Reindeer
47.plot: The Nostalgia Critic welcomes in the Christmas season in an uncharacteristically calm fashion, and reviews the animated adaptation of that classic Christmas song: Grandma Got Run Over by a Reindeer. It follows the song to a tee as Grandma is kidnapped by Santa, who is then arrested for it and greedy Cousin Mel sets out to sell Grandma's multi-million dollar business. What were they smoking?

48.title: Overlooked Christmas Specials
48.plot: The Critic decides to give credit where it's due and look at some Christmas specials most people overlook, and tells us why it's a good idea to give them our attention this holiday season. From Bad Santa to Futurama to Pee-Wee's Christmas Special to Rifftrax, each one has something festive to offer in their own unique ways.

49.title: A Christmas Story 2
49.plot: Being a fan of the original Christmas Story, though a bit put-off by its over-abundance of merchandising, the Nostalgia Critic takes a look at the unnecessary 2012 follow-up. It sucks donkey balls in every respect, from acting to writing to over-used narration to Ralphie's immature day dreams. It really puts the Critic's Christmas spirit to the ultimate test. Fortunately, Hyper Fangirl and her Assassin are here to try and restore his faith.

50.title: What You Never Knew About Christmas Vacation
50.plot: In light of the hap-hap-happiest season of the year, a giddy Nostalgia Critic looks at the hilarious 1989 Christmas classic: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation. And when Santa squeezes his fat wide ass down that chimney tonight, he's going to find the jolliest 19 things about this movie that may have been overlooked.

51.title: Care Bears Nutcracker Suite
51.plot: To pull himself out of his post-Christmas funk, the Critic goes to a showing of The Care Bears Nutcracker Suite. It's your simple, basic Nutcracker re-telling with the Care Bears, but with annoying voice acting, poorly hidden plot twists and reused character designs.

1.title: The Matrix
1.plot: Believe it or not, The Nostalgia Critic doesn't like The Matrix. Not just the sequels, he doesn't like the originals. But when confronted by Agent Shmuck, representative of the fanbase, the Critic decides he might as well share with the world his true feelings on the overrated but innovative 1999 sci-fi thriller.

2.title: The Animatrix
2.plot: Matrix Month continues as the Critic looks at Japan's answer to the franchise: a series of beautifully, but bizarrely animated stories devoid of emotion, reason and rationale...just like The Matrix itself.

3.title: Matrix Reloaded
3.plot: Because the Matrix made a ton of money, the studio naturally commissioned a sequel, and because this is Matrix Month, the Nostalgia Critic looks at Matrix Reloaded. He finds it has too much action, too many needless fighting scenes, forced romances and very lazy writing. Meanwhile, Malcolmus and Tamity help the Critic outwit Agent Shmuck.

4.title: Matrix Revolutions
4.plot: Matrix Month wraps up with what is mercifully the final Matrix movie. It goes through the motions of pointless action and endless, pointless speeches from the main characters. Agent Shmuck brainwashes Malcolmus and Tamity and forces a reluctant Critic to finish his review, and when he does, he makes a deep, almost mind-boggling discovery about the Matrix series and its value to moviegoers everywhere.

5.title: Did Tom and Jerry Kill Themselves?
